channel.title: double ethernet in whonix gateway ?
channel.description:
i just wanted to ask what is the use of eth0 and eth1 both of them existing and working inside whonix-gateway ? (vbox version)
has something with anonymity or what?
(GW IPv4)
- eth0
address
10.152..152.10
netmask
255.255.255.0
gateway
10.0.2.2
- eth1
address
10.152.152.10
netmask
255.255.192.2.0
gateway
0.0.0.0
while in **WS** there is only one which is eth0:-
address
10.152.152.11
netmask
255.255.192.0
gateway
10.152.152.10
-----------------------
also is cloning the mac address useful in whonix ?

item.title: double ethernet in whonix gateway ?
item.dc:creator: entr0py
item.description:
If you look at VM Settings for Whonix Gateway in VirtualBox, you’ll see 2 network adapters - one connected to VBox’s NAT router, and one connected to Internal Network ‘Whonix’. eth0 connects to Tor eventually & eth1 connects to Whonix Workstation.

Internet — Host Network Adapter — VBox NAT — eth0 - Whonix GW - eth1 — Whonix WS

TNT_BOM_BOM:

also is cloning the mac address useful in whonix ?

Whonix

Computer Security Education

Basic Computer Security Advice. Useful Before Installing Whonix for Better Security.

Read full topic
